Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant is a Convention refugee under s. 96 of IRPA or a person in need of protection under s. 97
Outcome: Application for judicial review dismissed; Board's decision stands
Evidence_Type: Evidence of past political activities, country condition reports on Haiti, generalized violence levels
Basis_of_Claim: Political opinion and past political activities
Evaluation_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution; personalized risk not shared by general population
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Applicantâ€™s association with a group now considered criminal; generalized violence in Haiti
Proceeding_Type: Refugee protection claim and subsequent judicial review
Application_Error: No legal or factual error found in Board's assessment
Assessment_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to Board's decision
Legal_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution under s. 96; personal risk under s. 97
Application_Factor: Nature and extent of political involvement; current status of affiliated organization
Decision_Outcome: Claim dismissed; applicant not recognized as refugee or person in need of protection
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board (IRB), Federal Court on judicial review
Decision_Review_Issue: Existence of legal or factual errors in Board's conclusion
Cause_of_Refusal: Generalized risk in Haiti; lack of personalized threat; past affiliation with criminalized group
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient evidence of personalized risk for returnees
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to Board's interpretation of well-founded fear and personal risk
